course_title: Integrated Learning Experience in Environmental Health: Part 2
course_description: The course provides a productive, supportive and critical environment for the completion of integrative learning experiences (ILE). EH skills gained during the MPH program are applied and integrated. Students will submit a completed ILE paper that describes the justification, methodologies, findings, and products of their ILE project, as well as a poster presentation that summarizes the highlights of their project.
prerequisites: Only EOHMPH, EOHIHMPH, and EOHEPIMPH students have permission to enroll in this course.
schedule_location: W 1pm-2:50pm in R. Randall Rollins Bldg. R200
sections: Class Nbr: 2145, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 1-2:50p, Instructor: Team, Status: Open
